sub_title: Sustainability researcher and practitioner specialised on circular economy and society, degrowth and environmental discourse and policy analysis
summary:
- Environmental governance and sustainability researcher and practitioner with over 8 years of professional experience working on sustainability projects in Africa, Europe, Oceania and North and South America. 
- Interdisciplinary academic background in international development studies, political ecology, environmental governance, and urban planning from Utrecht University (PhD), the University of Melbourne (MA), University College London (Msc) and McGill University (BA). 
- Research and work areas include: circular economy and society, post-development theories (such as buen vivir), degrowth, nature-based solutions, urban studies, deliberative democracy and environmental discourse and policy analysis. 
- Latest publications: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Martin_Calisto_Friant

projects:
[{'title': 'Challenging Perceptions: Increasing the Potential for Environmentally Just Urbanisation in Old Fadama through Urban Agriculture and Community Led Waste Management', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Research project on the potential for urban agriculture in Old Fadama, the largest informal settlement in Accra, the Ghanaian capital

− Undertook preliminary desk research on the existing urban agriculture practices and devised a detailed fieldwork plan 
− Carried out fieldwork in Accra’s largest informal settlement using participatory research methods – including structured and unstructured interviews, focus groups, transect walks and participatory mapping
−Collaborated with the International Water Management Institute (IWMI) and City Alliance, as well as community organisations, savings groups and government agencies
− Communicated findings to different stakeholders in presentations, videos, a variety of maps, and a final report, which was then sent to key actors in the area
− Honed communication and social skills by dealing with different groups with diverging interests, and working in a group of seven', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Martin', 'last_name': 'Calisto Friant', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainability researcher and practitioner specialised on circular economy and society, degrowth and environmental discourse and policy analysis'}]}, {'title': 'Contesting the City: Reinventing the Commons', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Research project on the use of space in The City along the private-public dichotomy on the backdrop of the Occupy London Stock Exchange movement through the lens of environmental justice

− Undertook desk research on public and private space in The City; followed developments in the Occupy movement both in the media and on the ground
− Conducted a Participatory Action Research process including transect walks, participatory mapping and informal interviews.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Martin', 'last_name': 'Calisto Friant', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainability researcher and practitioner specialised on circular economy and society, degrowth and environmental discourse and policy analysis'}]}, {'title': 'Youth Empowerment Through Media', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'Coordinated with at risk youth to implement motivating projects  while promoting values of cultural relativism, respect and solidarity. 
Created a Lip-Dub music video as part of the various empowering activities that were carried out.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Martin', 'last_name': 'Calisto Friant', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainability researcher and practitioner specialised on circular economy and society, degrowth and environmental discourse and policy analysis'}]}]

For more information, see: https://just2ce.eu/', 'title': 'Postdoctoral Researcher', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 10608006, 'name': 'Copernicus Institute of Sustainable Development, Utrecht University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFBLYCROQpOqA/company-logo_400_400/0/1649078643418?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=N05kp7UZY5PVvrgtw_CQQaSwXHMRi8_AUxs-X4Ulm5w', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/copernicus-institute-of-utrecht-university/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Utrecht Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Copernicus Institute of Sustainable Development, Utrecht University', 'description': 'Part of the CRESTING project funded through the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Skłodowska-Curie grant agreement No 765198: http://cresting.hull.ac.uk/
Responsible for ESR 1.1 Synthesis of discourses on circular economy and its key challenges
First supervisor: Walter Vermeulen; Co-supervisor: Roberta Salomone; Second Supervisor: Ernst Worrel. 

"There is as yet no consensus on what is meant by a circular economy, although many organisations and authors have an idea of what it should mean.  This project will analyses the discourses of the circular economy within the three key fields of science, policy and market to understand the diversity of views and the perspectives they represent.  Using existing publications, policy documents, reports on public debates, roundtables, policy meetings and stakeholder interviews, the ESR will undertake a sociological discourse analysis focusing on the specific policies and market programmes in the countries participating in the ITN."

Objectives:
- Discourse and policy analysis of existing approaches to the CE across different contexts (geographic and sectoral, e.g., industry, governmental, academic)
- Policy analysis of CE approaches, under lying policy theories and level of policy integration in selected EU member states and on European level, assessing alignment between political and academic discourses;
- Discourse analysis of modes of conceptualizing CE in diverse industries and product markets and the substantiation of claiming’s on positive impacts (circularity, sustainability);
- Cross comparison of the discourses in the academic, policy and business domains and identification of implications for action.', 'title': 'PHD Researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 11857100, 'name': 'Fundación Terrasapiens', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGXy0bKyxwvww/company-logo_400_400/0/1536399384634?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=HOhrlFgAdyM3q9nGFNuTv0wr2c487Ivqhg5rVtOtEOc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/terrasapiens/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Quito Ecuador', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Fundación Terrasapiens', 'description': '•	Constitution of the foundation, which aims to protect nature and its rights through initiatives that promote a sustainable, fair, circular and resilient model of production and consumption.
